about this the way we do this is we write a press release so this sounds
crazy right every other company you first develop the service or the offering and then you write the press
release but at Amazon we write the press release first we nail the value prop we
even use quotes in there from customers that we've been talking to this really helps us to frame what we're going to
build before we actually build it a lot of companies that I work for they're so
focused on the technology that they build something in the technology and then they figure out what it's going to
be used for at Amazon we worked so hard at working backwards from the customer we write that press release first but it
doesn't stop there from the press release then we actually write a
frequently asked questions or an FAQ now these are questions like what what are
you gonna what are you gonna build what are you gonna take to market how are you gonna take it to market don't we get
into some really tough questions we want to know what our customers gonna be most
excited about in one sentence not everything one sentence what are they gonna be most disappointed about and
then we debate do we release it later so that we don't disappoint their customers
on these two things or is it more important to get it out there and experiment with it it's really a
powerful exercise to write the set of frequently asked questions before you even start building anything and then we
finally we start to look at the user interaction and the UX and this
was really interesting because we just released a product at innovate at reinvents orient reinvent and that

making sure it was easy for you our customers to use and leverage even Andy
our CEO wanted to see the UX because we know that that customer experience is so

that's almost opposite of a lot of other companies that build it and then they do

the person and the company that we're trying to solve for is that an IT
manager is it a system admin is it a DBA we really want to understand who that

people who are doing the research all from one company or who don't use this

but in Amazon we view two types of decisions one is a two-way door
